Package net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters

Class FunctionToFunctionAsync<T,​R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters.FunctionToFunctionAsync<T,​R>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the Func's parameter
    R - The type of the Func's return value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionAsync<T,​R>
    public class FunctionToFunctionAsync<T,​R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionAsync<T,​R>
    An adapter that converts a conventional Function to an FunctionAsync.

    All asynchronous calls are executed in another thread and forwarded to the Function.apply(Object) method.

    The Executor to use for the asynchronous invocations can be chosen during creation of this adapter. If no explicit executor is given the a default executor is used. The default executor can be set using the AsyncExecutor.setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property or is created automatically by the AsyncExecutor.

    Author:
    tilmann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      FunctionToFunctionAsync​(java.util.function.Function<T,​R> function)
      Converts the given Function to the interface FunctionAsync using the default executor
      FunctionToFunctionAsync​(java.util.function.Function<T,​R> function, java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
      Converts the given Function to the interface FunctionAsync and executes asynchronous call using the given Executor

    • Method Detail

      • beginApply

        public FunctionAsyncResult<R> beginApply​(java.util.function.Consumer<? super FunctionAsyncResult<R>> callback,
                                         java.lang.Object asyncState,
                                         T parameter)
        Asynchronously invoke this FunctionAsync with the given parameter value, callback and asyncState.

        Associated with each call to beginInvoke is a FunctionAsyncResult instance returned by the call and given to the callback that can be used to track the status and outcome of the invocation.

        Specified by:
        beginApply in interface FunctionAsync<T,​R>
        Parameters:
        callback - the Consumer, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of the FunctionAsync's invocation and receives the same FunctionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations FunctionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        parameter - the parameter value for the invocation
        Returns:
        the FunctionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
